thread.title: Source: Arroyo, Reds reach Minor League deal
thread.title_full: Source: Arroyo, Reds reach Minor League deal

author: Mark Sheldon
title: Source: Arroyo, Reds reach Minor League deal
text:
Source: Arroyo, Reds reach Minor League deal Veteran pitched in Cincinnati from 2006-13 Arroyo on potential Reds return 0:37 Bronson Arroyo discusses how a potential return to the Reds would be beneficial for his career as well as the team's young pitching staff By Mark Sheldon / MLB.com | @m_sheldon | + 0 COMMENTS 
CINCINNATI -- Pitcher Bronson Arroyo has passed his physical and will sign a Minor League contract that will return him to the Reds, a source told MLB.com on Thursday night. 
The Reds have yet to announce the deal, which is expected to include an invite to big league camp as a non-roster player during Spring Training. He will compete for the vacant fifth spot in the rotation against several other contenders, while likely providing a solid veteran influence. 
â€¢ Hot Stove Tracker 
Arroyo, who will turn 40 on Feb. 24, has not pitched in the Major Leagues since 2014 with the D-backs because he needed surgeries on both his elbow and shoulder. 
During his tenure with the Reds from 2006-13, Arroyo was 105-94 with a 4.05 ERA in 265 starts. Including his '05 season with the Red Sox, Arroyo pitched 200 or more innings in eight of the following nine seasons. has covered the Reds for MLB.com since 2006, and previously covered the Twins from 2001-05. Follow him on Twitter @m_sheldon and Facebook and listen to his podcast .
